description: Common quaking grass (Briza media) is an amazing species of grass. Its small stature and delicate flowers bring beauty to the meadow landscape. The flowers have a characteristic quaking motion when the wind blows, giving the grass its name. Its leaves are a bright green with silver streaks, and its small, hairy fruits have a light, airy texture. It is tolerant of both wet and dry soils, making it a hardy choice for all kinds of gardens. Its ability to out-compete aggressive weeds makes it a popular choice for naturalizing meadows and roadsides. With its unique texture, beauty, and hardiness, the common quaking grass is an amazing species to add to any garden.
